metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6826 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Tyson Smith, Bob Clary, and Alexandru Michis reportedmemory safety bugs present in Firefox 74. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 75.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '75.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
